sub_title: Global Director of Technical Accounting and Internal Controls
summary:
Adam is currently the Global Director of Technical Accounting and Internal Controls at Upfield, and is based in Amsterdam. Adam leads a team of 8 professionals and is responsible for overseeing the creation, implementation, and maintenance of the group accounting policies and the design of Upfield's internal controls framework. Additionally, Adam leads the analysis of complex accounting and reporting issues and oversees the documentation of Upfield's accounting position papers. He also serves as a business partner in assisting cross-functional stakeholders navigate the implications of complex accounting and reporting issues.

Prior to working at Upfield, Adam was a Senior Manager (US Director) in PwC's Capital Markets and Accounting Advisory Services Group, and was most recently based in Amsterdam. Prior to Amsterdam, Adam was based out of San Francisco. Adam advised a broad range of technology (software, SaaS, and internet advertising), retail and manufacturing, and private equity clients. Specifically, Adam specialized in assisting clients with complex accounting and reporting issues related to revenue recognition, leasing, business combinations, consolidation, day 1 operating model design, internal use software, compensation arrangements, carve-outs/divestitures under IFRS and US GAAP. Adam began his career as an auditor based out of PwC's San Jose office.

Adam graduated magna cum laude from Santa Clara University in June 2011 with a Bachelor of Science in Commerce - Accounting, and a minor in music. Adam is currently a licensed CPA in the state of California (license #120900).

profile_positions.description:
Advised and assisted Fortune 1,000 to Fortune 50 public technology clients - with a focus on software – in navigating the complexities of ASC 606. Specifically:
- Performed phase 1 impact assessments by advising and assisting clients in identifying key differences between ASC 605-25 and ASC 985-605 and ASC 606. Identified and assessed relevant revenue streams to perform assessment, performed contract reviews representative of revenue streams, and identified required policy changes in order to conform with ASC 606.
- Performed phase 2 impact assessments by advising and assisting clients in creating representative SAP use cases for software arrangements 
- Advised and assisted clients in drafting technical white papers regarding ASC 606 analysis and implementation of the new standard

Advised private equity and technology clients on complex accounting issues regarding business combinations and acquisitions (ASC 805). Areas of focus include: determining U.S. GAAP purchase price, employee compensation arrangements, allocation of goodwill, and determining whether or not components should be accounted for as a part of or separately from the business combination.
-Advised and assisted clients in drafting purchase accounting white papers

Advised and assisted public technology clients in navigating the complexities of ASC 842. Specifically:
-Performed phase 1 impacts assessments by advising and assisting clients in identifying key differences between ASC 840 and ASC 842. Reviewed key terms and conditions of existing lease portfolio in order to determine appropriate data fields required of systems to appropriate account for leases under ASC 842.
-Advised and assisted clients in drafting technical white papers regarding ASC 842 and adoptions of the new standard.

Co-presented and lead numerous conferences discussing the nuances of ASC 606.

profile_positions.description:
Adam developed the following skills during his time as an audit Senior Associate

*Audited and assessed client contracts for software revenue arrangements under ASC 985-605
(previously SOP 97-2 & SOP 98-9) for complex terms and conditions in order to determine appropriate accounting treatment.
         -Analyzed undelivered elements for allocation of fair value in accordance with VSOE.
         -Tested significant modifications of previous arrangements for appropriate accounting.
         -Tested management’s assumptions and compliance for VSOE over undelivered elements.
*Audited and assessed contracts for Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) arrangements under ASC 605-25 for complex terms and conditions and fair value allocation in accordance with BESP.
*Audited and assessed stock-based compensation under ASC 718 for equity awards granted to employees and non-employees (ASC 505-50).
*Provided auditing services to clients for initial public offerings (IPO): specifically managed the comfort letter, tie-out and review of SEC filings, and assisted with communications to external counsel for the investment bankers.
*Audited and assessed financial processes by supervising and reviewing detailed testing over financial statement line items and testing of internal controls over financial reporting. Emphasis in order-to-cash and revenue.
*Provided auditing services to clients regarding initial Sarbanes-Oxley 404 implementations.
*Active leader, supervisor, and coach providing continuous feedback and training on technical accounting matters, audit methodology, and client relationship building.
*Significant experience with Microsoft Office Products: Excel, Word, and PowerPoint
